Key Match Events: Mahmoud Al-Aswad scored the opener in the seventh minute
Daleho Irandust and Pablo Sabbag punished India on the counter and scored two more to seal a solid win for Syria
Syria delivered the killer blow in the 76th minute, taking advantage of the hosts' paucity of men at the back
Syria got their third goal with the last kick of the game via another counter-attack
Pre-Game Insights: India head coach Manolo Márquez made seven changes, from the line-up which was held 0-0 by Mauritius
Syria head coach José Lana rotated all 11 players from Syria's 2-0 victory over Mauritius three days ago
Post-Match Reflections: After the match, Márquez said, 'I am angry with the first half. We were scared and not brave at all.'
Syria head coach José Lana said, 'I am very happy with our performance. I'm delighted with how we did in the tournament with a young squad.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Hon'ble Chief Minister of Telangana, Shri A Revanth Reddy, presented the winners' trophy to Syria
Syria captain Mahmoud Al-Mawas was named the Syed Abdul Rahim Player of the Tournament
Others: India spent the entire game on the chase after Mahmoud Al-Aswad scored the opener in the seventh minute
The introduction of Naorem Mahesh Singh also added another dynamic to India's attack
The Indian substitutes kept the fire on in the latter minutes of the game, and were perhaps unlucky not to get a goal back
